info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 9:18PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern La Paz, central Yuma and eastern Imperial Counties through 1000 PM MST/1000 PM PDT/... At 918 PM MST/918 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Ripley to 7 miles northeast of Yuma Proving Ground to 19 miles north of Tyson to 10 miles northwest of Paloma. Movement was southwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and blowing dust. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Martinez Lake, Fortuna Foothills, Wellton, Cibola, Tacna, Kinter, Andrade, Winterhaven, Araby, Yuma Proving Ground, Blaisdell, Tyson, Ligurta, Palm Canyon and Roll. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 1 and 54. CA Interstate 8 between mile markers 87 and 96. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 99. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
